sn48.39:0.3: 39. The Simile of the Fire Sticks
sn48.39:1.3: The faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity.
sn48.39:1.4: The faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn48.39:1.5: When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’
sn48.39:1.6: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.
sn48.39:2.1: The faculty of pain arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn48.39:2.2: When in a state of pain, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pain.’
sn48.39:2.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as painful, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pain ceases and stops.
sn48.39:3.1: The faculty of happiness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as happiness.
sn48.39:3.2: When in a state of happiness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of happiness.’
sn48.39:3.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as happiness, you understand that the corresponding faculty of happiness ceases and stops.
sn48.39:4.1: The faculty of sadness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as sadness.
sn48.39:4.2: When in a state of sadness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of sadness.’
sn48.39:4.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as sadness, you understand that the corresponding faculty of sadness ceases and stops.
sn48.39:5.1: The faculty of equanimity arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as equanimous.
sn48.39:5.2: When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’
sn48.39:5.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.
sn48.39:6.1: When you rub two sticks together, heat is generated and fire is produced. But when you part the sticks and lay them aside, any corresponding heat ceases and stops.
sn48.39:6.2: In the same way, the faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn48.39:6.3: When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’
sn48.39:6.4: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.

sn48.39:7.5: When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’
sn48.39:7.6: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.”
